snippet: A native of India who studied an array of pragmatic and softer subjects at Harvey Mudd College in California argues that a broad education, and not just specialization, is essential in the current economy.
abstract: A native of India who studied an array of pragmatic and softer subjects at Harvey Mudd College in California argues that a broad education, and not just specialization, is essential in the current economy.
lead_paragraph: Today on "The Choice on India Ink,'' a weekly feature we produce for a Times blog aimed at an Indian audience, Vedika Khemani, a graduate of Harvey Mudd College in California, makes the case -- even in the current economy -- for the value of studying subjects that might not necessarily seem pragmatic, at least on first blush. Ms. Khemani, who is a native of Kolkata, India, and who has studied physics and math, as well as creative writing and history, writes:

headline.main: Making the Case for the Liberal Arts
